intro: Peucedanum laciniatum, commonly known as the fringed cow-wheat, is a flowering plant native to southern and eastern Europe. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its fern-like leaves and umbel-shaped inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its flowers are usually pink or white, and it produces small, dry fruits called schizocarps. The species is sometimes used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported digestive and anti-inflammatory properties.
